name: DiskCatalogMaker Thumbnail-Enabled Catalog
summary: Learn about .DCMD files and view a list of programs that open them.

content: Mac users can use DiskCatalogMaker to create catalogs that list the files stored on their hard drive, external drives, CD and DVD discs, and other media. Typically, these catalogs are saved as DCMF files. However, if a user wants to include thumbnail images in their catalog (to help them recognize specific files), they can save the catalog as a DCMD file. DCMD files contain thumbnails for files that can be opened using macOS's Quick Look feature, such as images, movies, audio files, and documents.
NOTE: DiskCatalogMaker 5.0 and earlier versions cannot create or open DCMD files.

instructions: You can open a DCMD file in Fujiwara DiskCatalogMaker (Mac). Select File â†’ Open... from the program's menu bar, then open your DCMD file.
You can use Fujiwara DiskCatalogMaker to convert a DCMD file's contents to the .CSV (Comma-separated Values) or .TXT (Plain Text) formats. Note that these files will not contain any thumbnail images.
